citation.article-title: Salinibacter ruber gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel, extremely halophilic member of the Bacteria from saltern crystallizer ponds.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Salinibacter ruber sp. nov.
Salinibacter ruber (ru'ber. L. adj. ruber red)
Cells are motile, straight or slightly curved rods, measuring 2.6x0.4 μm.
Colonies on agar are red, about 1 mm in diameter, circular and convex with an entire margin.
Pigment extracts in methanol/acetone (1:1, v/v) show an absorption maximum at 478 nm and a shoulder at 506-510 nm.
Extremely halophilic, growing optimally at total salt concentrations of 150-300 g l-1 and requiring at least 150 g salt l-1 for growth.
The optimal pH range for growth is 6.5-8.0 and no growth is observed below pH 6.0 or above pH 8.5.
Tween 80 is not hydrolysed and Tween 20 is hydrolysed weakly or not at all.
No indole is produced from L-tryptophan.
Sensitive to penicillin G, ampicillin, chloramphenicol, streptomycin, novobiocin, rifampicin and ciprofloxacin.
Insensitive to streptomycin, kanamycin, bacitracin, tetracycline, colistin, anisomycin and aphidicolin.
The G+C content of the DNA is 66.5 mol% (HPLC).
The type strain is strain M31T (=DSM 13855T=CECT 5946T), isolated from a saltern crystallizer pond in Mallorca, Balearic Islands, Spain.
